it.matjaz.numerus

Class RomanCharMapFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.matjaz.numerus.RomanCharMapFactory

  • public class RomanCharMapFactory
extends Object
    Factory generating structures of pairs (roman character, its integer value) to be used in RomanConverter. This class offers four static constructors of collections keeping a reference between single roman characters and character pairs that are used for conversions of whole Strings of roman numerals. It does not offer a complete list of all roman numerals and their conversions, just methods for RomanConverter. The structures offered are:
    • Array of Pairs(String, Integer)
    • HashMap<String, Integer>, unmodifiable.
    • HashMap<Integer, String>, the exact opposite of the above one, unmodifiable.
    • DualHashBidiMap, bidirectional map, unmodifiable, from Apache Commons Collection 4.0

    The array of Pairs is hardcoded, while the other three Maps are filled using its Pairs. The structure of the array is based on the example of roman numerals convertion from fredosaurus.com. The pairs of values contained are:

    Roman,value
    M1000
    CM900
    D500
    CD400
    C100
    XC90
    L50
    XL40
    X10
    IX9
    V5
    IV4
    I1
    Author:
    Matja≈æ dev@matjaz.it matjaz.it

    • Method Detail

      • generateCharPairsArray

        public static javafx.util.Pair[] generateCharPairsArray()
        Constructs an array of 13 Pairs(roman character, its Integer value).

        Those pairs are used for conversions of whole Strings of roman numerals and vice versa. The pairs are hardcoded since they are constants.

        The followind table offers a representation of the content of the generated structure: 

               Pair
      __||__
     /      \
  i |rom  int
 ------------
  0 |  M 1000
  1 | CM  900
  2 |  D  500
  3 | CD  400
  4 |  C  100
  5 | XC   90
  6 |  L   50
  7 | XL   40
  8 |  X   10
  9 | IX    9
 10 |  V    5
 11 | IV    4
 12 |  I    1
        Returns:
        Pair[] containing Pairs of roman characters and the respecitve integer values.

      • generateCharMap

        public static Map<String,Integer> generateCharMap()
        Constructs an unmodifiable HashMap with 13 entries <roman character, its integer value>.

        The Map's keys are roman characters stored as Strings and they point to their integer values. Those entries are used for conversions of whole Strings of roman numerals. The Map is unmodifiable.

        The map returned by this method is the exact opposite of the one returned by generateInverseCharMap() (keys and values are switched). The Map is filled by inserting values from the generateCharPairsArray().

        The followind table offers a representation of the content of the generated structure: 

         key val
 rom int
 -------
  M 1000
 CM  900
  D  500
 CD  400
  C  100
 XC   90
  L   50
 XL   40
  X   10
 IX    9
  V    5
 IV    4
  I    1
        Returns:
        HashMap<String, Integer> containing roman characters as keys and the respective integer values.

      • generateInverseCharMap

        public static Map<Integer,String> generateInverseCharMap()
        Constructs a HashMap with 13 entries <integer value, equivalent roman character>.

        The Map's values are roman characters stored as Strings and they are references by their integer values. Those entries are used for conversions of whole Strings of roman numerals. The Map is unmodifiable.

        The map returned by this method is the exact opposite of the one returned by generateCharMap() (keys and values are switched). The Map is filled by inserting values from the generateCharPairsArray().

        The followind table offers a representation of the content of the generated structure: 

         key val
 int rom
 -------
 1000  M
  900 CM
  500  D
  400 CD
  100  C
   90 XC
   50  L
   40 XL
   10  X
    9 IX
    5  V
    4 IV
    1  I
        Returns:
        HashMap<Integer, String> containing roman characters as values and the respective integers as keys.

      • generateBidiCharMap

        public static org.apache.commons.collections4.BidiMap generateBidiCharMap()
        Constructs an unmodifiable DualHashBidiMap with 13 entries <roman character, its integer value>.

        The BidiMap correlates roman characters stored as Strings and their integer values. Those entries are used for conversions of whole Strings of roman numerals. The Map is unmodifiable.

        The map returned by this method is a BidiMap from the Apache Commons Collection 4.0, which means it can be accessed by its keys with get(Object) or by its values with getKey(Object). The Map is filled by inserting values from the generateCharMap().

        The followind table offers a representation of the content of the generated structure: 

         key val
 rom int
 -------
  M 1000
 CM  900
  D  500
 CD  400
  C  100
 XC   90
  L   50
 XL   40
  X   10
 IX    9
  V    5
 IV    4
  I    1
        Returns:
        DualHashBidiMap<String, Integer> containing roman characters as and the respective integer values.
        See Also:
        org.apache.commons.collections4.bidimap
